name: dysk
description: Linux utility to get information on filesystems, like df but better

repo.name: dysk
repo.description: A linux utility to get information on filesystems, like df but better

readme.summary: Clear visual presentation with good examples, but critical information (installation, usage commands, troubleshooting) is only available through external documentation links.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions in README - users must visit external website to learn how to install or use the tool

injection_risks.description: The filter argument is not properly sanitized, which could lead to potential injection risks if user input is not validated.
The col_enum macro uses string matching for column names, but it does not seem to be vulnerable to injection attacks as the input is limited to a predefined set of values.

critical_findings: Potential injection risk in the filter argument
Lack of proper input validation for some arguments
security.summary: The code has some potential security issues, including a possible injection risk and lack of proper input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Platform-specific bugs (macOS inodes, WSL disk reporting, Btrfs performance)
Release management issues (version tag inconsistencies, Cargo.toml not updated)
Missing features and platform support (color with watch, inode display, AFP filesystem support)
Output formatting bugs (color reset even when disabled, broken pipe panic)
praise_themes: Recently added macOS support (positively received despite limitations)
Tool functionality works well when configured correctly
sentiment.summary: Dysk shows active maintenance with recent platform expansion, but community health is hampered by recurring release management oversights and unresolved platform-specific bugs that frustrate users across different operating systems.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are consistently helpful, clear, patient, and technically sound, making them an exemplary model for open-source communication.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite recent activity timestamp
18 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date indicates lack of release cadence
maintenance.summary: The project appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and accumulating unresolved issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is comprehensive and clear, but lacks categorization and migration guides, with breaking changes properly marked.

governance.summary: The governance documentation for the homebrew package 'dysk' lacks a clear succession plan, decision-making process, and contributor ladder, indicating a high bus factor risk.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Only one contributor active in the past six months
Open issues outnumber closed issues in the same period
Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and troubleshooting section
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential injection risk in the filter argument
Security: Lack of proper input validation for some arguments
High bus factor risk (96% from top contributor)
highlights: Steady stream of commits and merged PRs in the last six months
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
